body: I hesitate a little what would be better for such a feature - to add the optional parameter (my preference so far), or to add a new function html_escape_once($var).
You know a PR is always better than writing code in comments ... As for the better solution - that would be an additional parameter, that shouldn't be a question at all.
I hesitated a little bit what to choose, PR is to come.

issue.title: Upgrading the function html_escape()

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
Escaping twice can be prevented by setting the second argument to FALSE.

See #3201

body:
The fix changed the original behavior when applied to an associative array.

Test case:

```
$array = array( "zero" => 0, "one" => 1 );
print_r(html_escape($array));
```

Expected:

```
Array(
    [zero] => 0
    [one] => 1
)
```

Actual:

```
Array(
    [0] => 0
    [1] => 1
)
```

I confirm that there is a change of the original behavior, it is hidden within the function array_map(). Maybe for some preserving keys is valuable.

@narfbg Is there need for a correction? I think about usage of array_walk_recursive() function.
Or just array_walk(), I'll see which one is suitable.
@csksm It will not work on PHP 5.2.4, which as far as I know is still silently supported.
